author: Ruohang Feng (rh@vonng.com)
description: PostgreSQL Monitoring for Remote RDS instances (with limited metrics)

panels.description:
All instances among pgsql cluster ${cls}

Instance: Goto PGSQL Instance

IP: Goto PGSQL Node

Status: Goto PGSQL Service

Load: max(cpu,postgres,pgbouncer)

Space: Disk space usage max(all device)

Proxy: session number, Goto Haproxy Admin Page

targets.expr: count by (ins)(pg_pubrel_count{ins="$ins"}) > bool 0 or on() vector(0)

panels.description:
Database of this cluster ${cls}

Load: active_time / backends (PG14 only)

Query RT : max query rt of this database

Client: Pgbouncer Active Clients

Server: Pgbouncer Active Servers

Backend: Postgres num backends

T = is Template?

D = Disabled in Pgbouncer ?

P = Paused in Pgbouncer ?

links.title: PGRDS Instance : Idle in Transaction Conn

panels.description:
Load, 1 = 100% one cpu core usage.
Calculated by session active time  (PG14+)

Load for Instances / Databases in last 5 minutes
load 1 = 100% usage of 1 core cpu time
Alerting event graph. Each stripe represent an alerting Event. Gray transparent stipe are pending alerts.

Rate in last 5min of:


pg_stat_database. xact_commit: Number of transactions in this database that have been committed

pg_stat_database. xact_rollback: Number of transactions in this database that have been rolled back

on this postgres instance.
panels.title: Transaction Commits / Rollbacks (rate5m)

panels.description:
pg_stat_database: active_time / (xact_commit + xact_rollback)


Time spent executing SQL statements in this instance / Number of transactions in this instance in last 1 minute


Only available on PG14+
panels.title: Transaction RT (1m)

panels.description: Transaction Committed rate in last 1 minute, group on database level
panels.title: TPS by Database (rate1m)

panels.description:
Postgres Load Index in last 1 minutes


rate(pg_stat_database.active_time[5m])


load 1 = 100% usage of one cpu core.


Calculated by session active time  (PG14+) @ database level.
panels.title: Postgres Load (rate1m)

panels.description: Tuples fetched from databases r/s in last minute, group by database on this instance.
panels.title: Row Fetched (rate1m)

panels.description: Tuples fetched, inserted, updated, delete r/s in last minute, on this instance
panels.title: Row Modified (rate1m)

panels.description:
Table lock categorized in to 3 major categories:
Read locks, Write Locks, and Exclusive locks.
panels.title: Locks by Category

panels.description: Table Locks in 8 different mode, on this instance
panels.title: Locks

panels.description: Very long transactions, max elapse time (y) group by session state. On this postgres instance
panels.title: SAGE

panels.description: Ratio of database session / max allowed sesion per database. the limit is min of max_connections and database's connection limit.
panels.title: Connection Usage

panels.description: Idle in Transaction backend number of all databases in this instance.
panels.title: Idle in Transaction Backends

panels.description: Number of database backend process / session by database.
panels.title: Backends

panels.description:
Newly established session on each database.
Increase number of last 1 minute
panels.title: New Sessions (increase1m)

panels.description: Backend number group by state in this instance.
panels.title: Backends by State

panels.description: Backend number group by backend type in this instance.
panels.title: Backends by Type

panels.description: Max connection duration group by session time.
panels.title: Max Conn Lifespan

panels.description: Backend number group by wait event type in this instance.
panels.title: Backends by Wait Event

panels.description: Time spent executing SQL statements in this database
panels.title: Active% (of Session Time)

panels.description:
Abandon: Number of database sessions to this database that were terminated because connection to the client was lost


Fatal: Number of database sessions to this database that were terminated by fatal errors


Killed: Number of database sessions to this database that were terminated by operator intervention


available on PG 14+
panels.title: Sessions Failure in 1m

panels.description: Rate of lsn in last minute
panels.title: LSN Progress (rate1m)

panels.description: XID Usage of each databases in this instance.
panels.title: Age Usage

panels.description: Database 4k blocks access
panels.title: Blocks Access 1m

panels.description: Database 4k blocks hit ratio in last 1 minute
panels.title: Blocks Hit Ratio (1m)

panels.description: Database 4k blocks access
panels.title: Blocks Read (1m)

panels.description: Database size on cluster primary
panels.title: Database Size

panels.description: Database Size Change on Cluster Primary in Last 10 minutes
panels.title: Database Size Delta 10m

panels.description: Database Transaction Commit Rate in last 1 minute
panels.title: TPS by Database (rate1m)

panels.description: Active processs for each database in this cluster
panels.title: Session by Database

panels.description: Database 4k blocks hit ratio in last 1 minute
panels.title: Database Blocks Hit Ratio (1m)

panels.description: number of dangerous idle in transaction backend in different database amoung this cluster
panels.title: Idle in Transaction Backends

panels.description:
Connection used ratio of min(
  max_connections @ instance level,
  connlimit @ database level
)
panels.title: Connection Usage

panels.description: Tuples fetched from databases among this cluster
panels.title: Row Fetched

panels.description: Tuples fetched, inserted, updated, delete among this cluster group by database
panels.title: Row Modified

panels.description: Index Scan + Seq Scan on this table per second
panels.title: Table Scan (scan/s)

panels.description: Top Query Time Spent among this cluster
panels.title: Query Time

list.description: IP address of this postgres instance
list.label: IP
list.name: ip

list.description: Sequence number of this instance, which is an unique integer among a postgres cluster
list.label: Sequence
list.name: seq

list.description: Cluster identifier for this postgres instance, cls should be unique among entire environment. such as pg-meta, pg-test
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cls

list.description: Node name of current postgres instance
list.label: Node
list.name: node

title: PGRDS Instance
